items.title: Rare Sumatran rhino gives birth after eight miscarriages
items.description: The critically endangered Sumatran rhino gave birth to a female calf in an Indonesian sanctuary.

items.title: Peru inflation: Civilians and police clash in Peru protests
items.description: Protests have taken place across Peru, as oil, gas and toll road prices rise.

items.title: Ukraine war: Many more cities like Bucha says President Zelensky
items.description: Volodymyr Zelensky addressed the UN Security Council for the first time since Russia invaded Ukraine.

items.title: Ukraine war: Rescuing vulnerable children from the front line
items.description: A BBC crew follows an ambulance team as medics evacuate 12 children from the city of Sumy.

items.title: Ukraine war: President Zelensky visits site of alleged atrocities in Bucha
items.description: The Ukrainian president says people have been found in barrels, having been strangled and tortured.

items.title: Ukraine war: Bucha massacre is a game changer - Ukraine foreign minister
items.description: Dmytro Kuleba told BBC HARDtalk that events in Bucha prove how much help Ukraine needs from the West.

items.title: Bondi Beach: Huge tides engulf Sydney's famous beach
items.description: Scenes of swells washing over Australia's most famous beach and its promenade have stunned locals.

items.title: Curious owl inspects TV weather station camera
items.description: The camera in Great Falls, Montana, captured the moment the bird peeked into its lens.

items.title: The Ukrainian mother who had to bury her own son
items.description: Iryna Kostenko tells the BBC's Jeremy Bowen how Russian soldiers killed her 27-year-old son and took over her home.

items.title: Ukraine war: The women sharing their memories of Ukraine before the war
items.description: Four women who shared viral videos of Ukraine before the war speak to the BBC about those memories.

items.title: Rogue pastors, fake miracles and murder
items.description: Across Africa, extreme Christianity is threatening the faith of many.

items.title: Ukraine war: The popular politician who escaped a targeted missile strike
items.description: The social media-friendly Ukrainian governor Vitaliy Kim overslept while his office was destroyed.

items.title: Sri Lanka: Tear gas and water cannon used in Kandy
items.description: Protesters were mostly students, angry with their government's handling of the country's economy.

items.title: Ukraine war: Mum describes bomb crashing into her family home
items.description: Olena Selichzianowa says she pulled her twin boys beneath her to protect them from flying shrapnel.

items.title: Zelensky spokesman describes heartbreaking scenes in Ukraine
items.description: A spokesman for Ukraine's President Zelensky describes the discovery of mass graves.

items.title: Smoke rising in Ukrainian port city Odesa after strikes
items.description: Smoke is seen after explosions are heard in the strategic southern port city of Odesa on the Black Sea coast.

items.title: War in Ukraine: Evidence grows of civilian killings in Bucha
items.description: The BBC's Jeremy Bowen reports on the growing evidence of civilian killings in Bucha, near Kyiv. His report contains some distressing images.

items.title: War in Ukraine: Kokoâ€™s phone is your phone as she makes her way out
items.description: British-Zimbabwean student Korrine Sky documented her escape from Ukraine on her mobile phone.

items.title: Ukrainian refugee with Royal College of Music scholarship in visa limbo
items.description: Nadiia Chaichenko and her family fled their home in Kharkiv at the start of the war.

items.title: The handshake in space that brought hope to the world
items.description: What happened when US astronauts met USSR cosmonauts in space

items.title: Ukraine: Why the cartoon Masyanya was banned in Russia
items.description: Masyanya is a YouTube cartoon star in Russia, but her episode on the Ukraine war has been banned.

items.title: Russian MP says Putin's plan for Ukraine hasn't been shared with their parliament
items.description: Maria Butina says Putin's plan wasn't shared with MPs, but the campaign is going "according to plan".

items.title: How do you do a face-to-face interview with Zelensky?
items.description: Zanny Minton Beddoes, editor-in-chief of The Economist, on how she interviewed Ukraine's president.

items.title: WATCH: Missiles strike oil depot in Belgorod, Russia
items.description: Firefighters tackle a blaze at a facility near the Ukrainian border, which Moscow says was attacked.

items.title: Ukraine war: The Syrians signing up to fight for Russia
items.description: Recruits are being offered thousands of dollars to be deployed on the front line in Ukraine.

items.title: Dog saved by Ukrainian soldiers from abandoned home
items.description: The dog named Bavaria was found as soldiers inspected abandoned flats on the frontline near Kyiv.

items.title: US astronaut and Russian cosmonauts return to Earth
items.description: They landed safely in Kazakhstan after leaving the International Space Station in a shared capsule.

items.title: Australia floods: Severe flooding strikes Australian east coast again
items.description: Home and business have been swamped, with residents forced to evacuate.

items.title: Ukraine war: Russian missile tears hole through Mykolaiv administrative building
items.description: Ukrainian authorities said at least seven people have died in the attack.

items.title: Ukraine war: Youngsters in Finland worried conflict could spread
items.description: In Finland, which borders Russia, some young people are worried the Ukraine conflict could spread.

items.title: Ukraine: Sheltering with monks in a Romanian monastery
items.description: The Ukrainian family who found shelter in a an unlikely place after fleeing Kharkiv.

items.title: War in Ukraine: Amongst wreckage in Hostomel Airport near Kyiv
items.description: The BBC's Jeremy Bowen reports from the airport, some 10 miles from Kyiv, which holds the wreckage of the world's biggest cargo plane.

items.title: Ukraine war: Bringing up a baby among the bombs
items.description: More than 1.5 million children have fled Ukraine since the beginning of Russia's invasion, says the UN.

items.title: Shane Warne: Australians reflect on cricket legend and 'man of the people'
items.description: Ahead of Warne's memorial service, ordinary Australians explain why his legacy transcends cricket.

items.title: Iran detainee Ashoori: â€˜I should have been back earlierâ€™
items.description: British-Iranian Ashoori, who was freed from prison in Iran, has spoken about his experience.

items.title: Best actor winner Will Smith took offence at a joke by presenter Chris Rock
items.description: The Oscars were halted momentarily when Will Smith took offence to a joke by presenter Chris Rock.

items.title: War in Ukraine: Graphic protest by Russian artist Yevgenia Isayeva
items.description: Yevgenia Isayeva doused herself in fake blood and chanted, "my heart bleeds" in the solo protest.

items.title: Ukraine war: The drone pilots monitoring Russian troops
items.description: The BBC joins a Ukrainian defence unit carrying out aerial reconnaissance around Kyiv.

items.title: War in Ukraine: Vladimir Putin cannot remain in power - Biden
items.description: A White House official says the US president was not calling for a regime change.

items.title: War in Ukraine: Musicians perform emotional concert in Kharkiv metro station
items.description: Musicians performed the concert at a metro station in Kharkiv, being used as a makeshift shelter.

items.title: Sidney Poitier's daughter on his Oscars legacy
items.description: Sidney Poitier's daughter discusses the late Oscar winner's influence on civil rights and cinema.

items.title: Baby goats and gardens to help with hospital stress
items.description: How cuddling a goat in a garden helps US medical staff and patients.

items.title: Civilian deaths: Aerial video shows escaping father killed in Ukraine
items.description: Video captured by a Ukrainian aerial reconnaissance group appears to show Russian forces shooting at civilians.

items.title: Ukraine war: Ros Atkins on... Putinâ€™s false â€˜Naziâ€™ claims
items.description: Russia is spreading untruths about Nazis in Ukraine - one of Putin's justifications for his invasion.

items.title: Taylor Hawkins: Bogota festival crowd reacts to Foo Fighters drummer's death
items.description: The band had been due to perform at the Estereo Picnic festival in Bogota, Colombia, on Friday night.

items.title: Coda star and Oscar nominee inspires deaf children to dream big
items.description: Troy Kotsur is a star of CODA and the first deaf male actor ever to be nominated for an Oscar.

items.title: Surviving deadly tornadoes that tore through the southern US
items.description: People describe harrowing experiences trying to survive tornadoes that tore through the southern US.

items.title: The ups and downs of teaching during Covid
items.description: From remote learning to the end of masking, Arielle has taught students throughout the pandemic.

items.title: Hazara: The female karate champions 'breaking out of the cage'
items.description: Women from the Hazara community say the martial art helps them break out of the restrictions their community faces.

items.title: Poland hotel becomes triage centre for cancer patients
items.description: Hundreds of children with cancer have now been evacuated from Ukraine to continue treatment abroad.

items.title: Ukraine war: Return to Irpin, the town destroyed in the battle for Kyiv
items.description: The BBC's Jeremy Bowen returns to Irpin, where Ukrainian forces say they're pushing back Russians.

items.title: Ukraine war: The dangers faced by front line fighters in Kharkiv
items.description: A month into the war, Mark and Vlad, both 22, show the BBC the perils they face every day in Kharkiv.

items.title: Michael BublÃ©: Multi-Grammy winner on Bond themes, romantic gifts and new album
items.description: An egg poacher, a toaster and the washing up - just some ways Michael BublÃ© shows his romantic side.

items.title: Australia floods: 'We're resilient, but how about helping us?'
items.description: Locals tell dramatic stories of survival and recovery, but accuse politicians of ignoring them.

items.title: Ukraine war: Smoke rises from Kyiv fuel depot Russia claims it has destroyed
items.description: Moscow says it targeted the largest remaining military fuel storage facility in Ukraine.

items.title: What are sanctions and do they work?
items.description: Sanctions are used by countries as a diplomatic tool, but they don't always have their intended effect.

items.title: Ukraine war: Digging a grave for my stepfather, killed in Mariupol
items.description: Viktoriaâ€™s stepfather died when the car taking him to hospital was blown up during fighting in Mariupol.

items.title: War in Ukraine: Explosion seen in Berdyansk as navy claims to destroy Russian ship
items.description: The Ukrainian navy says it has destroyed a Russian landing ship named the Orsk in the port city of Berdyansk.

items.title: War in Ukraine: Zelensky calls on people to 'support freedom' and oppose Russia
items.description: Volodymyr Zelensky made his appeal in English, marking one month since Russia invaded Ukraine.

items.title: Ukraine war: Destruction of cities shown from above
items.description: In the month since Russia's military invaded, it has laid waste to cities across Ukraine.

items.title: The Ukrainian refugee who loves to laugh at school in Poland
items.description: Ten-year-old Yana started school in Poland three weeks ago, after fleeing the war in Ukraine.

items.title: War in Ukraine: 'Pets are getting left at train stations'
items.description: A photographer from the UK travels to western Ukraine to rescue pets displaced by war.

items.title: US tornadoes: What the storm aftermath in Louisiana and Texas looks like
items.description: Homes are left destroyed by storms that tore through southern states, including Louisiana and Texas.

items.title: Ash Barty: Australians react to world tennis number one's shock retirement
items.description: The BBC hears from tennis players in Brisbane, where world number one Ashleigh Barty regular trained.

items.title: Taliban schools U-turn 'a devastating day' for Afghan girls - Malala Yousafzai
items.description: The Talibanâ€™s U-turn on girls' high schools is heartbreaking, the Nobel Peace Prize laureate says.

items.title: WATCH: Ukrainian sailing club protest superyacht linked to Abramovich in Turkey
items.description: A Ukrainian sailing team protest against the arrival of a superyacht linked to Roman Abramovich in Turkey.

items.title: Driver in pick-up truck flipped by Texas tornado
items.description: Watch the moment the vehicle is tossed in the air by the twister as storms swept across Texas.
